0.user_question: Darrell and Allen's ages are in the ratio of 7:11. If their total age now is 162, calculate Allen's age 10 years from now.

direct_answer.text:

(3) 162 - 11x = 0

Finally, we divide both sides by 11:

(4) x = 14.82

direct_answer.text:
Hint 2: Use Cramer's rule to solve the system. We need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix and the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing the first column with the values on the right side (i.e., 162 and 0). Then Allen's current age x is obtained as the quotient of these determinants, and Darrell's age at any time can be calculated using his formula. Here's the code in MATLAB:

```matlab
syms x
A = [7 -8/11; -1/11 1]; % Coefficient matrix
b = [162; 0];             % Right side vector
d = det(A);                % Determinant of A
da = det([A(1,:) b(1)]);   % Determinant with first column replaced
db = det([A(2,:) b(2)]);   % Determinant with second column replaced
x = da / d;                  % Allen's age now
dx = db / d;                  % Allen's age in 10 years
